Moving to SWT for comment. Looks like a dup of bug 88077.

This does seem strange and looks like it might be a VM problem (as
was the case in bug 88077).  Do you have any other VM versions
you can try?
Bug 88077 was refering to a 64-bit VM.  This one looks like it's 32-bit.
*** Bug 145498 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Based on the "Caused By" section of the trace, this does seem like a VM problem of a similar nature to bug 139519.  Can you try with a newer VM, either a 1.5 or a 1.4.2 whose date is in 2006, and follow up here with whether or not this helped?

I believe that this is a duplicate of bug 145498, which became fixed when the user added the missing package described in bug 139786.  Marking report as a duplicate; if installing this package does not help you get running then please reopen this report, thanks.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 145498 ***
